Definition: Last Illness
For the purposes of the final expense deduction, the term
last illness
means the period from the onset of the acute attack causing death to the date of death.Â  Generally, expenses incurred more than one year prior to date of death should not be considered expenses of last illness.
If death resulted from a lingering or prolonged illness instead of an acute attack, the period of last illness is considered to have begun at the time the person became so ill as to require the regular and daily attendance of another person.
